abstracts.cdata!:
This is a sectoral environmental
            assessment for the Bhutan Urban Development Project, which
            reviews environmental issues concerning urbanization. The
            following measures are recommended for mitigation: Water
            resources will be monitored and water treated to maintain
            water quality, particularly during monsoon periods. The
            district network system will be improved by replacing
            defective pipes and connections, and improving skills in
            pipelaying, as well as providing better materials, more
            quality control during construction, more regular
            maintenance, and civic education. More properly ventilated
            pit latrines will be built and households with septic tanks
            provided de-sludging and disposal facilities. Play-and-use
            toilets will be built in the town centers. A public
            awareness campaign will be aimed at making households
            responsible for keeping local drains clean. Staff will be
            trained to identify, prepare, and maintain solid waste
            disposal sites. Garbage separation and recycling will be
            activated through a public education campaign. Conservation
            of significant heritage sites will require increased
            attention to proper land use and zoning regulations and
            their enforcement. Where rivers are eroding their banks in
            some of the project towns, erosion control and protection
            measures will be taken.
